intro: Ranunculus auricomus subsp. ancorifolius, commonly known as the yellow water crowfoot, is a member of the Ranunculaceae family. It is characterized by its delicate, palmately divided leaves and showy yellow flowers with numerous stamens. This subspecies is typically found in wet or marshy habitats, such as pond margins and stream banks. Its flowers are usually 1–2 cm in diameter and bloom from spring to early summer. The plant is often used in ornamental gardening due to its attractive appearance and ability to thrive in moist conditions.
